intro: Fimbristylis psammophila, commonly known as the sand flat sedge, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. This species is typically found in sandy or coastal environments, often in dune ecosystems. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower spikes. The plant is adapted to withstand harsh, saline conditions and plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils.
